fields_of_interest: Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health
head_office_address: Marie Lyon 24 Malvern Close Winstanley Wigan
eu_initiatives: Health and in particular legislation relating to pharmaceuticals. European Reference Networks for rare diseases - congenital malformations.
organisation_name: Association for children damaged by hormone pregnancy tests (ACDHPT)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication: Raise awareness of the dangers of drugs in particular female sexual hormones. We want to ensure that drugs are thoroughly and independently tested before marketing and that stringent pharmacovigilance is executed consistently and transparently.
goals__remit: The Association for children damaged by hormone pregnancy tests represents families who suffered abnormalities, stillbirths and miscarriages, due to taking pregnancy diagnosis tablets. Our goal is to ensure that all members who suffered these injuries are recognised as victims of this drug. Our further activities focus on providing support and regular information along with opportunities for engaging with each other. We are a user-led non profit organisation set up in the UK in 1978 and recognised and governed by the Charities Act (Charity no.: 276658).
